docs.text:
Merlin.jl


Merlin.jl
 is a neural network library in 
Julia
.




Functions




Overview


Decoding


Training






Types


Variable


Functor






Functors




It aims to provide a fast, flexible and concise neural network library for machine learning.




Install


#julia
 Pkg.clone(
https://github.com/hshindo/Merlin.jl.git
)








Optional Requirements




cuDNN
 v4 (for CUDA GPU)

Overview


Merlin.jl provides many primitive functions.


Every computation is preserved.




Decoding


v
 
=
 
Variable
()

=
 
SGD
(
0.001
)



for
 
i
 
=
 
1
:
10

  
v

Variable
()

  
y
 
=
 
v
 
|
 
f1
 
|
 
f2

  
y
.
grad
 
=
 
ones
()

  
backward!
(
y
)

(

,

)

docs.title: Overview

docs.text: Merlin.jl provides many primitive functions.  Every computation is preserved.
docs.title: Overview

docs.text:
opt   =   SGD ( 0.001 )  for   i   =   1 : 10 
   v   =   Variable () 
   y   =   v   |   f1   |   f2 
   y . grad   =   ones () 
   backward! ( y ) 
   update! ( opt ,   y )  end
docs.title: Training

There are three basic types:




Variable


Functor


Optimizer






Variable

 has 
value
 and 
grad
.

=

(
AFArray
(
Float32
,
10
,
5
))


x
.
value


x
.
grad








Functor


Functor
 is an abstract type of functors.

docs.text:
Functors


#


Merlin.Concat
 
 
Type
.




🔨 Concat


Concatenates arrays along the given dimension.




Concat(dim::Int)




👉 Example


x1
 
=
 
Variable
(
rand
(
Float32
,
7
,
5
))


x2
 
=
 
Variable
(
rand
(
Float32
,
10
,
5
))


f
 
=
 
Concat
(
1
)


y
 
=
 
f
(
x1
,
 
x2
)


y
 
=
 
f
([
x1
,
x2
])
docs.title: Functors

docs.text: Concatenates arrays along the given dimension.   Concat(dim::Int)
docs.title: 🔨 Concat

docs.text: x1   =   Variable ( rand ( Float32 , 7 , 5 ))  x2   =   Variable ( rand ( Float32 , 10 , 5 ))  f   =   Concat ( 1 )  y   =   f ( x1 ,   x2 )  y   =   f ([ x1 , x2 ])
